page.title: 02Allimore Green Common
page.content: Allimore Green Common is a conservation area where plants and insects are kept safe from harm.It is a 61/2 acre field which belongs to the Staffordshire Conservation Trust lying just outside Haughton and is looked after by Mrs Leigh, who lives in Eccleshall.The area is unploughed,undrained grazing land which is rich in plants and insects and has many rare species.At the back of the field is a little pool which stays wet when the weather is hot and so the plants survive.One of the plants we especially wanted to see was the Spotted Orchid which has pink petals with purple spots.Marsh Marigolds,Spear Thistles,Milkworts,Ragged Robins.Birdsfoot Trefoil.Fairy Flax,Marsh Valerian,Southern Marsh Orchid,Black Medick are also to be found.
